benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: Happy path coverage: TC01 (happy path creation), TC02/TC05 (optional headers), TC03 (account with no emails), TC04 (account with existing emails), TC16 (large payload) and TC21/TC22 (regression/backward compatibility) verify successful creation scenarios and correct response structures including 201 status and Location header.

Input validation and error handling: TC07 (invalid accountId format), TC08 (missing accountId), TC09 (non-existent account), TC10 (malformed JSON), TC11 (missing required fields), TC12 (invalid email format), TC17 (empty request body).
Header and authorization coverage: TC02/TC05 (headers present), TC13 (missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header), TC14 (unauthorized access).
Resource and payload validation coverage: TC06 (extra/unsupported fields in body), TC18 (additional query parameters), TC19 (slow DB), TC15 (external dependency down).
Security and resilience: TC23 (SQL injection in email), TC24 (XSS in email), TC25 (recovery from transient network failure).
Data visibility and integration: TC26 (integration/consistency) and TC04 (visibility of all emails on GET), TC27 (accessibility/documentation coverage).
gaps: Duplicate submission handling (idempotency) is not explicitly tested (e.g., posting the same email twice).
Internal server error scenario (500) is not covered (only 503 for external dependencies).
Caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) tests are not covered.
Edge-case coverage for exotic accountId formats beyond UUID (beyond TC07/TC08) could be expanded.
recommendations: Add a test for idempotent/duplicate submissions to validate handling (e.g., 409 or 422).
Add 500 Internal Server Error scenarios to ensure proper error handling on server/database failures.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under high load.
Add tests for caching headers and caching behavior (ETag/Cache-Control) for POST responses.
Expand accountId edge-case coverage with more exotic formats and whitespace scenarios to strengthen path parameter validation.
